ch.zhaw.it15a_zh.psit3_03.mealmanager.activities

Class ShoppingListViewActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        • android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
          • ch.zhaw.it15a_zh.psit3_03.mealmanager.activities.ShoppingListViewActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, ShoppingListAdapter.ItemClickCallback

    public class ShoppingListViewActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
implements ShoppingListAdapter.ItemClickCallback
    ShoppingListViewActivity is responspible for displaying all the shoppinglistitems. Each item is wrapped with a cardview, which holds all the buttons (plus-, minus-, check-buttons), itemname and amount of the item. And those cardviews are displayed in a RecyclerView. ShoppingListViewActivity allows the user to create, delete and check an item in the shoppingList.

      • addAmount

        public void addAmount(int adapterPosition)
        Certain amount will be added to the selected item. First of all ShoppingListViewActivity checks how much the increase will be. The increase is given as a parameter to , where the calculation happens.=> (ModelViewController-Pattern) is the controller in this case.
        Specified by:
        addAmount in interface ShoppingListAdapter.ItemClickCallback
        Parameters:
        adapterPosition - tells the position in the arrayList of the selected item.

      • removeAmount

        public void removeAmount(int adapterPosition)
        Certain amount will be subtracted from the selected item. First of all ShoppingListViewActivity checks how much the decrease will be. The decrease is given as a parameter to , where the calculation happens.=> (ModelViewController-Pattern) is the controller in this case. Also a Toast message will appear if the the user is removing too much amount, whether because it is mathematically not possible or because the rest of the amount belongs to a recipe.
        Specified by:
        removeAmount in interface ShoppingListAdapter.ItemClickCallback
        Parameters:
        adapterPosition - tells the position in the arrayList of the selected item.

      • changeBought

        public void changeBought(int adapterPosition)
        The selected item is going to be checked or unchecked, in by clicking the check-Button. adapterPosition tells the position in the arrayList of the selected item.
        Specified by:
        changeBought in interface ShoppingListAdapter.ItemClickCallback
        Parameters:
        adapterPosition - tells the position in the arrayList of the selected item.

      • showFullName

        public void showFullName(int adapterPosition)
        By clicking on the name of the item the full name will be shown in a dialog. In the dialog by clicking on the name again, the dialog will be dismissed. adapterPosition tells the position in the arrayList of the selected item.
        Specified by:
        showFullName in interface ShoppingListAdapter.ItemClickCallback
        Parameters:
        adapterPosition - tells the position in the arrayList of the selected item.
